items.author: podcast@268generation.com (Dr. Crawford Loritts)
items.content:
Dr. Crawford Loritts joins us this Father's Day for an encouraging message on what it looks like to kindle a fire of faithfulness for generations to come. 
— 

#faith #christian #sermon #passioncity #passioncityatlanta #atlanta #passioncitychurch #atlantachurch #christianity #Jesus #God 

— 

With Passion City Online, you can join us every Sunday live at 9:30a and 11:45a, and our gatherings are available on-demand starting at 7p! Join us at https://passioncitychurch.com 

— 

Subscribe to our channel to see more messages from Passion City Church: https://www.youtube.com/passioncitychurch1 

— 

Looking for content for your Kids? Subscribe to our Passion Kids Channel: https://passion.link/passionkidsonline 

— 

If you would like to give to our house, visit https://passioncitychurch.com/give/ 

— 

Check out Passion's books, music, and more at https://passionresources.com/ 

— 

At Passion City Church, we believe that because God has displayed the ultimate sacrifice in Jesus, our response to that in worship must be extravagant. It is our privilege, and our created purpose, to reflect God’s Glory to Him through our praise, our sacrifice, and our song. 

— 

Follow Passion City Church: https://www.instagram.com/passioncity/ 

Follow Louie Giglio: https://www.instagram.com/louiegiglio 

Passion City Church is a Jesus church with locations in Atlanta and Washington D.C.

items.author: podcast@268generation.com (Louie Giglio)
items.content:
Pastor Louie introduces listeners to a refreshed and re-released version of his book Not Forsaken, titled, Seeing God as a Perfect Father. Having compiled years worth of additional content around the idea of God as ‘Father,’ Pastor Louie shares some of his findings in this powerful talk. From the “greatest story ever told”–the story of the Prodigal–Pastor Louie reminds listeners who are plagued by a performance-driven faith that they too are already loved by a perfect heavenly Father. 

VERSES // Luke 15:11-31

— 

With Passion City Online, you can join us every Sunday live at 9:30a and 11:45a, and our gatherings are available on-demand starting at 7p! Join us at https://passioncitychurch.com

items.author: podcast@268generation.com (Earl McClellan)
items.content:
Pastor Earl McClellan dropped into Passion City to encourage listeners around the story of Paul and Silas’ missionary journey to Philippi. McClellan speaks to all kinds of important truths, from the dynamic nature of God’s will and the importance of the ‘marketplace’ in ministry to the authority given to us and the opportunity to witness in the midst of suffering. 

VERSES // Acts 16:6-33

items.author: podcast@268generation.com (grant partrick)
items.content:
By pointing to the parables and teachings of Jesus, Pastor Grant Partrick urges listeners to forgive others out of a grateful inclination, knowing that they have been forgiven an incomparable debt. 

VERSES // Matthew 7:3-5; 18:21-35, 1 Corinthians 13:5, Psalm 103:12, Psalm 130:3

items.author: podcast@268generation.com (Louie Giglio)
items.content:
Pastor Louie points out seven things we cannot do in heaven that we are going to wish we did on Earth. These are the temporary opportunities that we all will think more about when we come face to face with Jesus. Since we have just “five seconds” to live for the Kingdom of God, let us be people who leverage all five for His glory! 

VERSES // Revelation 20:11-21, Revelation 21:3-5, Luke 19:11-26, Matthew 6:19-20

items.title: 7 Things You Can’t Do In Heaven - Louie Giglio

items.author: podcast@268generation.com (Louie Giglio)
items.content:
Pastor Louie challenges listeners by drawing attention to the 'dash' that represents our lives–the tiny mark on gravestones that properly represents the 'mist' of a life we live. Ironically, however, it is the brevity of life that reminds us how precious it is to live and how crucial it is to live for Jesus. 

VERSES // 2 Peter 3:8-15, Psalm 90:10-12, Psalm 39:4-5, James 4:13-17, Luke 12:14-21

items.title: What on Earth Are You Doing with Your Life? - Louie Giglio

items.author: podcast@268generation.com (Passion City Church)
items.content:
Pastor Grant Partrick joins us for THE FIVE, challenging us to take into account what our deepest desire is. He teaches that our values show what we desire, and our desires show in our actions. Specifically relating to our finances, our lives are a reflection of what we love and it cannot be devoted to both God and money.

VERSES // Isaiah 26:8, Proverbs 4:23, Matthew 6:19-24, Proverbs 22:7, 1 Timothy 6:6-10, Hebrews 12:11, Psalm 37:4, Psalm 145:16

—

items.title: The Way of Jesus in Our Wants and Desires - Grant Partrick

items.author: podcast@268generation.com (Louie Giglio)
items.content:
Pastor Louie takes listeners further into a conversation about life and death by addressing the reality of the Great White Throne Judgment. The truth is that believers in Christ will face a post-salvation judgment of their works – not for the sake of admittance into the Kingdom and the presence of God but for the sake of reward. Those who invest in what is earthly will see all their treasure burn up as waste but those who live faithfully, having invested their resources and time into the Kingdom, will reap an eternal reward. 
 

VERSES // Revelation 20:11-15, 2 Corinthians 5:6-10, Hebrews 9:27, 1 Corinthians 2:10-15, 2 Corinthians 5:9-21, 2 Timothy 4:6-8

—

items.title: Do Believers in Christ Face Judgment? - Louie Giglio

items.author: podcast@268generation.com (Louie Giglio)
items.content:
Pastor Louie helps listeners answer the question, “what happens when we die?” Everyone has considered this humbling question but few have investigated what is the most reliable and coherent answer in the person of Jesus. By drawing attention to the reality of eternity, Pastor Louie urges listeners to be all the more faith-oriented in the life we are given. 

VERSES // Ecclesiastes 3:2, John 3:16-18, John 5:24-29, Romans 3:23; 6:23, 2 Corinthians 5:6, Philippians 3:21, 1 Corinthians 15:35-54, 1 Thessalonians 4:13-18, Luke 16:19-31, Matthew 25:31-46

items.title: What Happens When You Die? - Louie Giglio

items.author: podcast@268generation.com (Louie Giglio)
items.content:
Easter Sunday is a powerful reminder of the gift we have in access to a holy God. Pastor Louie shares about “God’s terms” to highlight how undeserving we are and how gracious He is in desiring to be in relationship with us. Just as the high priest was—by mercy—able to stand alive in the presence of a holy God, we too have access by the blood of Jesus to a set-apart and glorious God. 

VERSES // Matthew 27:45-55, Matthew 28:5-7, Genesis 3:21-24, 2 Chronicles 3:14, Exodus 28, Hebrews 10:19-22, John 17:3

— 

With Passion City Online, you can join us every Sunday live at 9:30a and 11:45a, and our gatherings are available on-demand starting at 7p! Join us at https://passioncitychurch.com

itunes.subtitle:
Easter Sunday is a powerful reminder of the gift we have in access to a holy God. Pastor Louie shares about “God’s terms” to highlight how undeserving we are and how gracious He is in desiring to be in relationship with us. Just as the high priest was—by mercy—able to stand alive in the presence of a holy God, we too have access by the blood of Jesus to a set-apart and glorious God.

VERSES // Matthew 27:45-55, Matthew 28:5-7, Genesis 3:21-24, 2 Chronicles 3:14, Exodus 28, Hebrews 10:19-22, John 17:3

items.title: Alive in the Presence of a Holy God - Louie Giglio

items.author: podcast@268generation.com (faith, christian, sermon, passion city, passion city atlanta, atlanta, atlanta church, christianity, Jesus, God, preach, preacher, church, jesus christ, christianity, louie giglio, Louie Giglio, passion city church)
items.content:
Pastor Louie talks to listeners about God-inspired dreams and visions and the “thief” that comes to steal our dreams. In sharing about the life of Joseph, Pastor Louie points out that it is often through delay, betrayal, false accusation, being overlooked, jealousy, humiliation, exasperation, revenge, success, pain, separation, and comparison that the thief can successfully crush the dream God has for our life. However, it is faithfulness that kills the thief of dreams. 

VERSES // Psalm 126, Genesis 37:11, Genesis 17-20, Genesis 41:14, Genesis 39-46, Genesis 50:15-20

—

items.title: The Thief of Dreams Must Die - Louie Giglio

items.author: podcast@268generation.com (Louie Giglio)
items.content:
Inspired by Passion’s recent trip to the Holy Land, Pastor Louie shares a powerful talk on the "road" to revitalized dreams. The excavation of the “Pilgrim Road” drove Pastor Louie to share on the importance of God’s timing and His will to draw us into His presence. Under the ruin, the layers of dirt and decay lie a path toward freedom and a relationship with God. It is on this path and in His presence that we regain our ability to dream; to envision our unique life lived for the glory of God and the good of others.

 VERSES // Psalm 126, Acts 2:14-21, Isaiah 60:22, Joel 2:28-32

—

items.title: Out of the Ashes to Dream Again - Louie Giglio

items.author: podcast@268generation.com (lee strobel)
items.content:
Lee Strobel has been directing skeptics to the investigation of the person of Jesus since The Case For Christ came off the press in 1998. In this talk, Strobel urges listeners to live their lives on the "evangelistic edge" by asking the question, “What would it look like if Jesus lived under your roof?” 

VERSES // Matthew 5:12-16, James 5:18, 1 Peter 3:15

—

items.title: The Unexpected Adventure - Lee Strobel

items.author: podcast@268generation.com (Louie Giglio)
items.content:
To close out a powerful collection of talks on the enemy and the weight of anxiety, Pastor Louie leads listeners in a response; to declare Jesus over our circumstances and join in prayer with those who are in the pit of their struggle with anxiety. He shares four crucial words to respond as followers of Jesus to the pressure that comes with our anxious thoughts: Humble, Cast, Lift, and Care. By walking through the process embedded in these words and in this Scripture, we respond as God intended us to respond to fear, depression, and anxiety. 

VERSES // 1 Peter 5:6-7

—

To close out a powerful collection of talks on the enemy and the weight of anxiety, Pastor Louie leads listeners in a response; to declare Jesus over our circumstances and join in prayer with those who are in the pit of their struggle with anxiety. He shares four crucial words to respond as followers of Jesus to the pressure that comes with our anxious thoughts: Humble, Cast, Lift, and Care. By walking through the process embedded in these words and in this Scripture, we respond as God intended us to respond to fear, depression, and anxiety. 
VERSES // 1 Peter 5:6-7

items.title: The Best Thing to Do With Your Anxiety - Louie Giglio

items.author: podcast@268generation.com (Passion City Church)
items.content:
Pastor Louie addresses the issue of anxiety by exhorting our House to direct our attention “upward.” Anxiety is a massive weight and it drags people down year after year. However, there are offensive tactics we can take, says Pastor Louie. We can “gaze upward,” turning our attention from an issue to a Healer, and experience progress and healing even in a pit of despair. 

VERSES // Psalm 42, Psalm 121:1

items.title: Finding Up When Anxiety Weighs You Down - Louie Giglio

items.author: podcast@268generation.com (Brett Younker, Hannah Brencher)
items.content:
Hannah Brencher + Brett Younker join us for THE FIVE for a conversation about mental health and mental illness and what that looks like through the lens of scripture. As Hannah shares her own experience battling depression and anxiety, we can be encouraged that we are not alone in the battle of the mind. 

VERSES // Matthew 22:37, Philippians 4:4-9

items.title: The Way of Jesus in Our Mental Health - Brett Younker + Hannah Brencher

items.author: podcast@268generation.com (Louie Giglio)
items.content:
Pastor Louie leads our House into a new Collection of Talks, titled, ‘Putting an ‘X’ Through Anxiety’.  In this talk, Pastor Louie urges listeners to get back in touch with the breath of God—His Spirit. It is breathing IN the truth about God and the actual physical breath that He gives us that ultimately combats the anxiety and depression that ravage our nation. It is in breathing OUT worship and truth that ultimately leads to an offensive attack on the schemes of the Enemy.

VERSES // Ezekiel 37:1-14, Genesis 1:2, Genesis 2:7, Acts 17:25, Romans 8:9

items.author: podcast@268generation.com (Grant Partrick)
items.content:
Pastor Grant Partrick shares a convicting talk about distraction and its role in the theft of the devotion God deserves. He challenges listeners through the story of Martha’s busyness to bring awareness to the pressing and increasing need for attentiveness. 

Pastor Grant highlights three major truths to lead us to ask the question, “are there any things you need to stop doing, start doing, or do differently?”: 

1. Distraction is the great enemy of devotion. 

2. Busyness is never the goal. 

3. Our distractions move toward devotion through a vehicle called ‘Discipline’. 

 

VERSES // Luke 10:38-43

—

items.title: The Power of an Adverb - Louie Giglio

items.author: podcast@268generation.com (Brad Jones)
items.content:
Pastor Brad Jones took our House into our final talk before Christmas Eve by highlighting the theological significance of Jesus’ arrival: When Jesus came, grace came. This reality was of massive significance to a people steeped in religiosity. As people who have received grace, we are now to grow in grace - toward others and ourselves. 

VERSES // John 1:14, John 1:1-5, John 1:18, John 1:36-42, 2 Peter 3:18

— 

With Passion City Online, you can join us every Sunday live at 9:30a and 11:45a, and our gatherings are available on-demand starting at 7p! Join us at https://passioncitychurch.com

items.title: When Grace Comes to Town - Brad Jones

items.author: podcast@268generation.com (louie giglio)
items.content:
In this advent message, Pastor Louie emphasizes a few major components of the story of Jesus' birth; that the story—that Jesus is King—has global significance, it is staunchly opposed by the darkness, and it ends with every knee bowing to King Jesus. Let the "Wise" people seek Him today, family, because He is who He says He is. 

VERSES // Matthew 2:1-11, Matthew 1:16-17, Acts 2:22-24, Philippians 2:6-11, Revelation 11:15-19 

— 

With Passion City Online, you can join us every Sunday live at 9:30a and 11:45a, and our gatherings are available on-demand starting at 7p! Join us at https://passioncitychurch.com

itunes.subtitle:
In this advent message, Pastor Louie emphasizes a few major components of the story of Jesus' birth; that the story—that Jesus is King—has global significance, it is staunchly opposed by the darkness, and it ends with every knee bowing to King Jesus. Let the "Wise" people seek Him today, family, because He is who He says He is. 

VERSES // Matthew 2:1-11, Matthew 1:16-17, Acts 2:22-24, Philippians 2:6-11, Revelation 11:15-19

items.title: May I Have Your Attention Please? - Louie Giglio

items.author: podcast@268generation.com (Louie Giglio)
items.content:
Pastor Louie leads our House into the Advent season by highlighting the miraculous birth of Jesus, through Mary, the “blessed and highly favored” mother of Jesus and instrument for God’s grace-filled work. Pastor Louie directs followers of Jesus to sit long enough under the “flow” of God’s grace to be moved to worship and reciprocation of the same great blessing. 

VERSES // Luke 1:26-80

items.title: Blessed and Highly Favored - Louie Giglio

items.author: podcast@268generation.com (Louie Giglio)
items.content:
Do you ever feel like God is silent? Pastor Louie looks to the 400 years that God was quiet in the Bible, teaching that we can have a posture of worship and trust that God is going to come through on His promises despite our ability to not hear Him. 

VERSES // Luke 1:5-25, Luke 1:57-67, 2 Corinthians 5:7, Malachi 3:1, Malachi 4:5-6

items.author: podcast@268generation.com (Grant Partrick)
items.content:
Joining us for another message this Sunday, Pastor Grant Partrick teaches that it is God’s desire for His children to be conformed to the likeness of His Son. By taking our thoughts captive, actively fighting against sin, and offering ourselves to God we can live lives pleasing to Him. 

VERSES // Leviticus 9:2, Leviticus 20:26, 1 Peter 1:15, Romans 8:29, Romans 8:1-13, Romans 7:21-25, Philippians 2:12-13, Ephesians 6:17, Romans 6:4, Romans 6:12-14, Romans 12:1 

—

items.title: A Change in Power - Grant Partrick

items.author: podcast@268generation.com (Grant Partrick)
items.content:
Pastor Grant joins us for a message on saying goodbye to shame and condemnation and saying hello to confession and freedom in Christ. While we are all guilty of sin, God calls us to walk in the light and experience a deep sense of freedom because of the sacrifice Jesus made for us on the cross.

VERSES // Genesis 2:25, Genesis 3:7, Luke 15:18-19, Romans 8:1-4, Colossians 2:3-15

items.title: Goodbye Shame - Grant Partrick

items.author: podcast@268generation.com (jonathan pokluda)
items.content:
Jonathan Pokluda joins us for THE FIVE, teaching that the resurrection matters because it happened, confirms Jesus as our savior, and gives us hope. As we move through the New Testament, several stories illuminate the weightiness of His resurrection and how that impacts our relationship with Jesus today. 

VERSES // 1 Corinthians 15:3-8, 1 Corinthians 15:17-18, Acts 2:29-32, Matthew 28:12, John 21

items.content:
Pastor Louie wraps up our current collection of talks, SHIFT, focusing on how you pray. When we pray, he encourages us to make it personal, lead with praise, ask for alignment, tell Him our needs, clear the air, acquaint ourselves with His word, embrace the silence, and have a heart of gratitude. 

VERSES // John 5:19, John 8:38, 1 Thessalonians 5:18,24, Psalm 46

items.title: How Do I Pray? - Louie Giglio

items.author: podcast@268generation.com (Louie Giglio)
items.content:
“If God already knows everything, then why pray?” Pastor Louie answers this question by encouraging our House to take heart, teaching that it moves the heart of God when prayer is bold and faith-filled. Our prayers have the power to surround His throne like incense. 

VERSES // Psalm 115:3; 139:4; Job 42:2; Matthew 17:20; Luke 7:1-10; John 12:23-28; Acts 4; Revelation 5 

— 

With Passion City Online, you can join us every Sunday live at 9:30a and 11:45a, and our gatherings are available on-demand starting at 7p! Join us at https://passioncitychurch.com 

—

items.content:encoded:
“If God already knows everything, then why pray?” Pastor Louie answers this question by encouraging our House to take heart, teaching that it moves the heart of God when prayer is bold and faith-filled. Our prayers have the power to surround His throne like incense. 

VERSES // Psalm 115:3; 139:4; Job 42:2; Matthew 17:20; Luke 7:1-10; John 12:23-28; Acts 4; Revelation 5

items.author: podcast@268generation.com (Grant Partrick)
items.content:
Pastor Grant joins us from The Five, reminding us that only in the Christian life can pain not be purposeless and permanent. We can have confidence that though our lives may include suffering, the story will end with God getting all of the glory and all of the praise. 

VERSES // Romans 8:28, 2 Corinthians 4:18-19, John 9:2-3, Matthew 14:22-24, Matthew 14:32, Psalm 119:71, 2 Corinthians 4:16-17, John 16:33

items.author: podcast@268generation.com (Louie Giglio)
items.content:
In our current collection of talks titled, ‘SHIFT,’ Pastor Louie challenges the idea that so many people hold: “My prayers don’t work.” He responds to this thought by directing our House to try realigning our will with the will of God, praying through Scripture, knowing it is God’s will on a tangible page, and praying bold, offensive prayers. 

VERSES // 1 John 4:14-15; Acts 1:8; 4:20-28; Ephesians 4:32; 1 Thessalonians 5:17; Revelation 21:4

items.title: Alignment and Authority - Louie Giglio

items.author: podcast@268generation.com (Louie Giglio)
items.content:
Continuing in our current collection of talks, Shift, Pastor Louie challenges how we come before God in prayer. As he breaks down the many requests we put before God out of habit and religion, he instead encourages us to pray out of a desire to have a close relationship with the creator of the universe and remix our ritualistic prayers.

VERSES // Matthew 5:4,6:5-8,10, Ephesians 1:3, Genesis 49:22-26, Galatians 2:20, Acts 4:29-30, Colossians 2:13-14

—

VERSES // Matthew 5:4,6:5-8,10, Ephesians 1:3, Genesis 49:22-26, Galatians 2:20, Acts 4:29-30, Colossians 2:13-14

items.title: 3 Keys to a Fresh Perspective on Prayer - Louie Giglio

items.author: podcast@268generation.com (Passion City Church)
items.content:
Pastor Brad closes out our ‘Open House’ collection of talks by urging us to live our lives set apart and as a response to the goodness of God toward us. His talk reminds us that our lives—though seemingly ordinary—can be available and used to impact the world, by the grace of God.

VERSES // Romans 1:16-17,12:1-21

Discussion Questions //

  1. Pastor Brad begins the talk by sharing about the potential we hold as “ordinary” people. What “ordinary” person have you seen do something incredibly impactful?
  2. Pastor Brad says ‘pride’ is the greatest threat to our church. What does he mean by this?
  3. Where are you most prideful? In other words, when do you feel the need to exalt your own reputation?
  4. If you can identify instances where you are prideful, can you identify the source of your pride? What is the reason or the insecurity behind your prideful action?
  5. Maybe you are having a hard time seeing your actions as prideful. How about starting with this question: When was the last time you subtly bragged or quietly boasted in something about yourself?
  6. Pastor Brad urges our House to live humbly because humility is attractive to others and it leads to influence. How do you practice humility?
  7. Pastor Brad shares, “Honor is INexpensive” and “Jealousy is expensive.” What does he mean by this?
  8. Pastor Brad encourages our House to be hope-filled people because it stands out to others. Living with hope is one of the most difficult things we do because it is always paired with hardship. When was the last time you had to focus intently on the hope we have as followers of Jesus? What were you facing in that valley of life?
  9. What stands out from Pastor Brads talk? What did you need to be reminded of?
  10. Reread the Scripture Pastor Brad references. What did you need to be reminded of in these texts?

— 

With Passion City Online, you can join us every Sunday live at 9:30a and 11:45a, and our gatherings are available on-demand starting at 7p! Join us at https://passioncitychurch.com 

— 

Subscribe to our channel to see more messages from Passion City Church: https://www.youtube.com/passioncitychurch1 

—

— 

If you would like to give to our house, visit https://passioncitychurch.com/give/ 

— 

Check out Passion's books, music, and more at https://passionresources.com/ 

— 

At Passion City Church, we believe that because God has displayed the ultimate sacrifice in Jesus, our response to that in worship must be extravagant. It is our privilege, and our created purpose, to reflect God’s Glory to Him through our praise, our sacrifice, and our song. 

—

items.content:
Aynsley Younker teaches that Jesus is the only way because He did the work—by dying on the cross for everyone in the world for eternity. While we address this pivotal question in faith, we stand on the truths of who God is, believing that the Bible is true and that He is real. 

VERSES // John 4:19-26,8,14:1-12, Philippians 2:8, 2 Corinthians 5:21, Romans 5:8

items.author: podcast@268generation.com (Louie Giglio)
items.content:
This past Sunday, Pastor Louie was back with a message about the return that comes with kingdom investment. When we sow into the Kingdom of heaven, we invest in an initiative that reaps unquantifiable return. As we were able to bless numerous organizations through Above + Beyond, He reminds us that our gifts are now launched into the atmosphere and used for kingdom purposes. 

VERSES // Matthew 5:14-16,16:24-25, Exodus 2:1-10

items.content:encoded:
This past Sunday, Pastor Louie was back with a message about the return that comes with kingdom investment. When we sow into the Kingdom of heaven, we invest in an initiative that reaps unquantifiable return. As we were able to bless numerous organizations through Above + Beyond, He reminds us that our gifts are now launched into the atmosphere and used for kingdom purposes. 

VERSES // Matthew 5:14-16,16:24-25, Exodus 2:1-10

items.author: podcast@268generation.com (grant partrick)
items.content:
Pastor Grant brought our House back from Sabbath by introducing a new collection of talks, ‘Open House.’ Sharing from Matthew 5:13-16, Grant reiterates that we are here to be a preservative to the goodness that was modeled by Jesus and reflectors of the marvelous light of God. So, we seek reconciliation, not retaliation. We resist greed through generosity. And finally, we submit to authority rather than rebelling against it.

VERSES // Matthew 5:13-16,5:44-48, Genesis 1:3, James 1:17, John 8:12,9:5, 2 Corinthians 4:6, 1 Peter 2:9,3:5, Ephesians 5:8, Hebrews 10:24-25

items.author: podcast@268generation.com (Louie Giglio)
items.content:
This is Above + Beyond Sunday–a day where our House gives above our normal giving so that we can go beyond where we normally go. In this talk from Pastor Louie, the invitation–to step into the investment that reaps an exponential return–is extended. This is invitation is about more than what is monetary. It is about surrendering to Jesus and placing our everything in His hands. 

VERSES // Romans 7:21-25,8:1-2, Colossians 3:1-4, Mark 12:42-44

items.title: Into the Above and Beyond - Louie Giglio

items.author: podcast@268generation.com (Passion City Church)
items.content:
Catherine shares how she got plugged in at Passion City Church D.C. through the power of an invitation, leading to her putting her faith in Jesus and pursuing an intimate relationship with Him. Through her story, we see how generosity and community can ignite a fire in people to seek answers to their questions about their own faith. This is Catherine's story.

 

Find out more about Above + Beyond by visiting https://passioncitychurch.com/above-and-beyond.

items.content:encoded:
Catherine shares how she got plugged in at Passion City Church D.C. through the power of an invitation, leading to her putting her faith in Jesus and pursuing an intimate relationship with Him. Through her story, we see how generosity and community can ignite a fire in people to seek answers to their questions about their own faith. This is Catherine's story.

 

Find out more about Above + Beyond by visiting https://passioncitychurch.com/above-and-beyond.

items.author: podcast@268generation.com (Louie Giglio)
items.content:
In this talk leading up to Above + Beyond Sunday, Pastor Louie sits down with financial expert, Allison Dukes, to have a conversation about the biblical view and understanding of finances. God wants us to simultaneously live wisely with the resources He has entrusted to us all the while being open-handed and entirely trusting of the One who oversees and allocates every resource. 

— 

With Passion City Online, you can join us every Sunday live at 9:30a and 11:45a, and our gatherings are available on-demand starting at 7p! Join us at https://passioncitychurch.com

Picking back up from our talk last week, Pastor Louie dives deeper into what it means to live as a Christian. items.author: podcast@268generation.com (Louie Giglio)
items.content:
“God is still calling us to a process and a lifestyle of becoming everything He has created us to become, and by grace, He extends mercy to us every single day.” 

Continuing in our current collection of talks, Believer, Pastor Louie stresses that being a Christian is more about who you are than what you do. To be Christian, we are called to be Christ-like, love God, extend grace, shine light, and champion those in need. When we can be mirrors, reflecting the glory of God, others can see Christ. 

VERSES // John 1:14,3:16, Philippians 2:1-16, Galatians 2:20, 2 Corinthians 5:14, 1 Corinthians 1:23, Luke 10:27, Matthew 5:13-16 

— 

With Passion City Online, you can join us every Sunday live at 9:30a and 11:45a, and our gatherings are available on-demand starting at 7p! Join us at https://passioncitychurch.com

items.content:encodedSnippet:
“God is still calling us to a process and a lifestyle of becoming everything He has created us to become, and by grace, He extends mercy to us every single day.” 
Continuing in our current collection of talks, Believer, Pastor Louie stresses that being a Christian is more about who you are than what you do. To be Christian, we are called to be Christ-like, love God, extend grace, shine light, and champion those in need. When we can be mirrors, reflecting the glory of God, others can see Christ. 
VERSES // John 1:14,3:16, Philippians 2:1-16, Galatians 2:20, 2 Corinthians 5:14, 1 Corinthians 1:23, Luke 10:27, Matthew 5:13-16

items.title: What It Means to Live as a Christian - Louie Giglio

items.author: podcast@268generation.com (Louie Giglio)
items.content:
"Instead of getting caught up in the exclusivity of the claims of Christ, why don't we just live out the beauty of Christ?" 

Pastor Louie launches a new collection of talks, Believer, with a powerful message about what it means to be Christian. Believing in Christ is inclusive to everyone, though he identifies how our lives should identify Christ when we choose to follow Him. As followers of the Way, we entrust Jesus to lead us, and people who don't know Him will follow close behind. 

VERSES // John 3:10-18, 2 Timothy 1:12, Acts 4:32,9:1-2,11:18-26

items.content:
“God is asking us to renew our trust in Him because He’s 100% faithful.” 

 

Aaron Coe joins us this Sunday to encourage us to trust God because of His perfect track record. Through what He says, does, and the price He has paid, we can fully rest in the fact that He who promised is faithful. 

VERSES // Hebrews 10:23, Philippians 2:6-8

items.content:
“God supersedes the failed and flawed climate.” 

Heading into week three of God of the Impossible, Pastor Louie reminds us that our mindset should begin with possibility and end with the confidence of hope. God is accomplishing something in a flawed and failed world, and all we need to do is believe Him for it. 

VERSES // Acts 2:22-28,27:21-26, Luke 22:42, John 14:11, 2 Timothy 1:12

items.title: The Ultimate Impossibility - Louie Giglio

items.author: podcast@268generation.com (louie giglio)
items.content:
“I’m going to start with possible, but at the end of the day I’m going to surrender in confidence to your sovereign will.” 

Pastor Louie Giglio brings a strong message into week two of God of the Impossible, highlighting the power of shifting our mindset and prayers toward possibility. Though we may not see a shift happening after we pray, we can believe that something will happen that reflects the power of our Father. We’re encouraged to ask for a miracle, believe that God is working, and surrender it into His hands. 

VERSES // Jeremiah 32:17, Matthew 26:39-44 

—

items.content:encoded:
“I’m going to start with possible, but at the end of the day I’m going to surrender in confidence to your sovereign will.” 

Pastor Louie Giglio brings a strong message into week two of God of the Impossible, highlighting the power of shifting our mindset and prayers toward possibility. Though we may not see a shift happening after we pray, we can believe that something will happen that reflects the power of our Father. We’re encouraged to ask for a miracle, believe that God is working, and surrender it into His hands. 

VERSES // Jeremiah 32:17, Matthew 26:39-44 

—

items.title: The Impossible Prayer - Louie Giglio

items.author: podcast@268generation.com (Louie Giglio)
items.content:
“No matter what your season, your story can end in restoration.” 

Pastor Louie Giglio journeys through the book of Jeremiah, reminding us that God is a God of the impossible. There is loss in life on a broken planet, but even in the loss, God is working a redemption story. He encourages us to have ears to be attuned to the Word of God and to stand firm in our corner of faith, believing that God will do what He says He will do. 

VERSES // Mark 10:23, Luke 1:37, Ephesians 3:20-21, Jeremiah 1:1-5,29:1,10-14,32:1-44

— 

With Passion City Online, you can join us every Sunday live at 9:30a and 11:45a, and our gatherings are available on-demand starting at 7p! Join us at https://passioncitychurch.com

items.title: God of the Impossible - Louie Giglio

items.author: podcast@268generation.com (Todd Peterson)
items.content:
“As we give our life away, God enlarges our world.” 

Today we are joined by our good friend, Todd Peterson, as he imparts wisdom on what it looks like to live a life of generosity instead of comfort. He illuminates the sacrifice of Jesus dying on a cross as the ultimate example of generosity. Jesus didn’t just give 10%, He gave everything. 

VERSES // Proverbs 11:24-26, Psalm 111:6, Isaiah 60:3, Matthew 24:14,28:18-20, Romans 10:14, Revelation 5:9,7:9, Acts 17:26 

—

items.title: God Wants to Save You From a Small Life - Todd Peterson

items.author: podcast@268generation.com (Brad Jones)
items.content:
“God desires and deserves your worship.” 

Pastor Brad Jones teaches through Mark 10, addressing the question, ‘What is the one thing God wants?.’ As we continue on the journey of life asking God for what we want, Pastor Brad challenges us to instead ask Him for what He wants, aligning our hearts to His desires and delighting in Him. 

VERSES // Mark 10:17-21, Matthew 4:10, Luke 10:38-42 

—

itunes.keywords: christian, christianity, sermon, god, passion city, faith, atlanta, atlanta church, passion city church, jesus, passion city atlanta
itunes.subtitle:
“God desires and deserves your worship.”

Pastor Brad Jones teaches through Mark 10, addressing the question, ‘What is the one thing God wants?.’ As we continue on the journey of life asking God for what we want, Pastor Brad challenges us to instead ask Him for what He wants, aligning our hearts to His desires and delighting in Him. 

VERSES // Mark 10:17-21, Matthew 4:10, Luke 10:38-42
itunes.summary:

VERSES // Mark 10:17-21, Matthew 4:10, Luke 10:38-42

items.title: The One Thing God Wants - Brad Jones

items.author: podcast@268generation.com (Louie Giglio)
items.content:
“You are free from the flesh to the degree that you are controlled by the Spirit.” 

Pastor Louie concludes week three of the Power of a Transformed Mind, by journeying through Romans 8; clarifying what it looks like for God to conform us to the likeness of Jesus, living for His glory, in contrast to being conformed to our sinful nature. 
 

VERSES // Romans 12:2, 8:1,6,9,15,17,28-30,31-39  

— 

With Passion City Online, you can join us every Sunday live at 9:30a and 11:45a, and our gatherings are available on-demand starting at 7p! Join us at https://passioncitychurch.com 

— 

Subscribe to our channel to see more messages from Passion City Church: https://www.youtube.com/passioncitychurch1 

— 

Looking for content for your Kids? Subscribe to our Passion Kids Channel: https://passion.link/passionkidsonline 

— 

If you would like to give to our house, visit https://passioncitychurch.com/give/ 

— 

Check out Passion's books, music, and more at https://passionresources.com/ 

— 

At Passion City Church, we believe that because God has displayed the ultimate sacrifice in Jesus, our response to that in worship must be extravagant. It is our privilege, and our created purpose, to reflect God’s Glory to Him through our praise, our sacrifice, and our song. 

— 

Follow Passion City Church: https://www.instagram.com/passioncity/ 

Follow Louie Giglio: https://www.instagram.com/louiegiglio 

Passion City Church is a Jesus church with locations in Atlanta and Washington D.C.

items.title: The Mindset That Leads to Life - Louie Giglio

PRODUCT: the Power of a Transformed Mind

items.author: podcast@268generation.com (Louie Giglio)
items.content:
Traveling through 1 Corinthians, Pastor Louie Giglio magnifies the meaning of having the cross as our true north. As our wounds, pain, loss, circumstances, opinions, beliefs, current state, and temporary pleasures shift, we are shown the power of the mind fixed on the finished work of the cross instead of the things of this world. 

VERSES // 1 Corinthians 2:1-16, Isaiah 53:5 

— 

With Passion City Online, you can join us every Sunday live at 9:30a and 11:45a, and our gatherings are available on-demand starting at 7p! Join us at https://passioncitychurch.com

items.content:
“There is no power apart from dependence.” 

This Sunday we had the privilege of being joined by Dr. Crawford Loritts, as he reminds us of the importance of the Holy Spirit in our walk of faith. Diving into the book of Acts, we are taught that demonstrating the power of God and living a supernatural life is a commandment. As the spirit of God structurally changes us, we must model it ourselves by obeying His command and continually submitting to His control. 

VERSES // Acts 1:1-8, John 13:16, Ephesians 5:18, Acts 2, Galatians 5 

—

“There is no neutral ground in the universe.” - C.S. Lewis

This Mother’s Day, Pastor Louie teaches through the book of Romans and illustrates what it looks like to live to have a mind transformed by the Word versus having a mind conformed by the world.

items.author: podcast@268generation.com (Ben Stuart)
items.content:
“If you’ve been changed, you change. Your identity changes your activity.”

Pastor Ben Stuart joins us this week from D.C. and takes us through 1 Peter. He shows us two ways we’re meant to be different from the culture around us in a difficult day: by anchoring our hope in Jesus and living out our faith in a way that reflects that hope.

VERSES // 1 Peter 1:13,17-21, 1 Peter 4:7, 1 Peter 5:7, 1 Peter 1:14-16, 1 Peter 2:11

items.author: podcast@268generation.com (louie giglio)
items.content:
In this Easter message, Pastor Louie Giglio addresses two main questions: Are the gospels the word of Jesus? And can they be trusted? He responds with a resounding yes, emphasizing that the Bible is the most authenticated and validated ancient document that you will ever hold in your hands, verifying that Jesus is the savior of the world. 

VERSES // John 3:16-17

items.title: What to Expect at the Table with Jesus - Louie Giglio

items.author: podcast@268generation.com (louie giglio)
items.content:
Pastor Louie Giglio kicks off a brand new collection of talks, At the Table with Jesus. He emphasizes the importance of making living in communion with God daily a priority and accepting His invitation to sit at the table with the King.

VERSES // Psalm 23:5, Hebrews 11:5-6, Genesis 5:6-24 

—

items.content:
Pastor Grant welcomes us into week 3 of By Faith as we journey through Hebrews and learn about the many great saints and how their faith set them apart. When faced with the temptation to throw in the towel, he challenges us to persevere with our faith in God instead. 

VERSES // Hebrews 10:36, 12:1,3, 6:11-12, 11:4,40, 12:10, Genesis 4:3-5, 1 Samuel 13:14, Acts 13:22, Psalm 119:34, 1 Samuel 16:7, Psalm 27:4, Psalm 20:7, Luke 3:31-32

items.author: podcast@268generation.com (Passion City Church)
items.content:
Continuing in our current collection of talks, By Faith, Pastor Louie Giglio dives into the book of Genesis and reminds us of when Abraham named Mount Moriah, the mountain where he was told to offer his son Isaac as a burnt offering, Yahweh Yireh. "On the mountain where the Lord will provide, is on the mountain where the Lord did provide." 

VERSES // Hebrews 11:1, 17-19, Genesis 22:1-18

Pastor Louie Giglio welcomes us into a brand new series, "By Faith". He teaches us that faith is a step into the promise. What promise has God spoken over you? Are you ready to fight for it? 

VERSES // Hebrews 11:1, 3, 6, 8-16, Hebrews 10:35-39 

— 

With Passion City Online, you can join us every Sunday live at 9:30a and 11:45a, and our gatherings are available on-demand starting at 7p! Join us at https://passioncitychurch.com 

— 

Subscribe to our channel to see more messages from Passion City Church: https://www.youtube.com/passioncitychurch1 

— 

Looking for content for your Kids? Subscribe to our Passion Kids Channel: https://passion.link/passionkidsonline 

— 

If you would like to give to our house, visit https://passioncitychurch.com/give/ 

— 

Check out Passion's books, music, and more at https://passionresources.com/ 

— 

At Passion City Church, we believe that because God has displayed the ultimate sacrifice in Jesus, our response to that in worship must be extravagant. It is our privilege, and our created purpose, to reflect God’s Glory to Him through our praise, our sacrifice, and our song. 

— 

Follow Passion City Church: https://www.instagram.com/passioncity/ 

Follow Louie Giglio: https://www.instagram.com/louiegiglio 

Passion City Church is a Jesus church with locations in Atlanta and Washington D.C. 

—

items.title: Put God First - Louie Giglio

items.author: podcast@268generation.com (Passion City Church)
items.content:
As we enter into the new year, Pastor Louie challenges us all to seek God first and to know Him more than we did the year before.

"But seek first the kingdom of God and his righteousness, and all these things will be added to you." Matthew 6:33

VERSES // Matthew 6:25-34, Luke 10:41-42, Psalm 27:8, Psalm 34:10 

— 

With Passion City Online, you can join us every Sunday live at 9:30a and 11:45a, and our gatherings are available on-demand starting at 7p! Join us at https://passioncitychurch.com

items.author: podcast@268generation.com (Passion City Church)
items.content:
*[SOON] in the biblical sense, is a relative term when used in relation to the eternal nature of the ALMIGHTY, who exists outside time and space, yet concurrently operates within the confines of finite human history as 'I AM; God the same yesterday, today, forever. Thus, the use of the term "soon' as understood by the eternal mind may be interpreted to mean promptly (as in right now) or to mean a future time, say within the next 100-1000 years, the later of which, in God time, is the equivalent of one human day, therefore "soon." 

— 

With Passion City Online, you can join us every Sunday live at 9:30a and 11:45a, and our gatherings are available on-demand starting at 2p! Join us at https://passioncitychurch.com

—

This week Pastor Louie Giglio kicks off our brand new series, CERTAINTY, by telling us the story of Hagar and the sparrow in Psalm 102. He teaches us that although we may feel like the sparrow on the roof, alone and isolated, God sees us and is with us in the midst of it all.

items.title: Because We Can - Louie Giglio

items.author: podcast@268generation.com (Passion City Church)
items.content:
As we wrap up our series "To the Ends of the Earth," we all have to ask ourselves, what do we consider worth spending our life doing, and potentially giving our life for? Pastor Louie Giglio helps us see the biblical answer to these questions from Paul's perspective found in his letter to Timothy. 

—

With Passion City Online, you can join us every Sunday live at 9:30a and 11:45a, and our gatherings are available on-demand starting at 2p! Join us at https://passioncitychurch.com/online

items.title: You Were Made for This - Andrew Scott

WORK_OF_ART: To The Ends of The Earth

items.author: podcast@268generation.com (Passion City Church)
items.content:
Have you ever asked the question, how can a loving God send people to eternal separation just because they never got the chance to hear? Consider this, maybe the greater question is how can I know the kindness of God and live my life without doing all in my power to share this message with every person on planet earth. Taking the Gospel to the ends of the Earth is an all-in mission, requiring an all-in church, and an all-in church requires an all-in you.

—

items.title: In the Meantime - Grant Partrick

items.author: podcast@268generation.com (Passion City Church)
items.content:
This week Pastor Louie Giglio reminds us of the incredible promise in Psalm 23. The King of the Universe has invited you to a table for two. He has prepared this place for you to dwell with Him and know Him, but there's an issue... the enemy is constantly on the prowl, searching for a moment where he can pull a third chair up to your table and interrupt your Holy conversation. It's time to tell him to leave, and through the power of Jesus to win the battle of your mind.

—

With Passion City Online, you can join us every Sunday live at 9:30a and 11:45a, and our gatherings are available on-demand starting at 2p! Join us at https://passioncitychurch.com/online

items.title: The Joy that Defies Every Condition - Louie Giglio

items.author: podcast@268generation.com (Passion City Church)
items.content:
Happiness is an emotion based on circumstances and outcomes, whereas joy is gratitude rooted in grace no matter the circumstances. So which are you fighting for today?

—

items.content:
Continuing our series, JOY, Pastor Brad Jones reminds us of how often Jesus talked about joy. Citing Luke 15, Pastor Brad walks us through the three parables that Jesus taught, and how each of them centered on us finding joy when our hearts align with God's heart. 

—

Give towards what God is doing through Passion City Church: https://passioncitychurch.com/give-on...​

—

items.title: Finding Joy - Brad Jones

items.author: podcast@268generation.com (Passion City Church)
items.content:
"Joy isn't informed by circumstances - true joy informs every circumstance."

—

Jump into our new series, Joy, with Pastor Louie Giglio as he walks us through the true meaning of Joy and how we can have access to it despite the circumstances we may find ourselves in.

—

Parents! With Passion City Online, you can join us every Sunday live at 9:30a and 11:45a, and our gatherings are available on-demand starting at 2p! Join us at https://passioncitychurch.com/online

https://www.youtube.com/passioncitychurch1

items.title: Searching for Happiness - Louie Giglio

items.author: podcast@268generation.com (Passion City Church)
items.content:
For centuries human beings have been running, pushing the ability of our bodies to go further, faster. We've set remarkable records at great and short distances, but the greatest distance ever covered was the gap that God ran through to get to us. This Easter message from Pastor Louie Giglio shows us the story of the Prodigal Son in a context you've never heard before.

—

Give towards what God is doing through Passion City Church: https://passioncitychurch.com/give-on...​

https://www.youtube.com/passioncitych...​

—

https://passion.link/passionkidsonline​

—

items.author: podcast@268generation.com (Passion City Church)
items.content:
What kind of faith has Jesus called us to? What kind of worship? What do we do when times are challenging, when our understanding is pushed to the limits? How do we respond? This week Pastor Grant Partrick reminds us that time after time our God has come through, and we can count on Him to do so again.

—

—

Follow Louie Giglio: https://www.instagram.com/louiegiglio

items.title: The Past is on the Mic - Louie Giglio

items.author: podcast@268generation.com (Passion City Church)
items.content:
"Those who hear God’s voice best are the people who know His Word most." For the last few weeks, we've been discussing how to remove the things that seek to compete with God for our attention, but once we do how do we tune our hearts to hear God when He speaks to us? In this message from Pastor Louie Giglio we learn some practical steps and guidelines to put in place so that we can carefully discern the voice of God in our lives.

—

items.content:

items.title: Religion is on the Mic - Louie Giglio

items.author: podcast@268generation.com (Passion City Church)
items.content:
We live in a world where we have access to millions of people's opinions, and they have access to us. In times like this, how do we separate God's opinion of us from others? In this message, Pastor Louie Giglio walks us through the practical ways that we can make sure God is on the mic.

items.title: Opinion is on the Mic - Louie Giglio

items.author: podcast@268generation.com (Passion City Church)
items.content:
Comparison is a trap that every one of us falls into sooner or later, but it doesn't have to be. If we can recognize the voice that is on the microphone calling us into these pitfalls, then we can learn to avoid them by following the voice of God instead. This week Pastor Louie Giglio reminds us of some practical ways to discern who is on the mic in our minds.

items.content:encodedSnippet:
Comparison is a trap that every one of us falls into sooner or later, but it doesn't have to be. If we can recognize the voice that is on the microphone calling us into these pitfalls, then we can learn to avoid them by following the voice of God instead. This week Pastor Louie Giglio reminds us of some practical ways to discern who is on the mic in our minds.

items.content:
This week we're kicking off a brand new series "Who's On the Mic?" Moment by moment in your life people, companies and even the enemy; are fighting to grab ahold of your attention and broadcast their opinions into your heart. But your soul belongs to the one who crafted them and knows what is healthy and prosperous for you to hear; only God deserves the microphone. 

—

items.content:
Waiting is never easy, and in the times we're living in it can be even harder. But, right here is where we are, and God is here with us. Yes, the world is pulling us in a hundred anxiety-inducing directions, but God has not left us, and when we place our trust in His mighty hands we are still secure.

items.title: Here - Ben Stuart

items.author: podcast@268generation.com (Passion City Church)
items.content:
400 years.That's how long the people of God waited to hear from Him before that deafening silence was broken with a baby's cry. And yet, even while the people of God waited they held on to a fundamental truth. God is working while you wait. Here's the good news, He's still doing it. He's still at work in your life, no matter how long you've been waiting for a miracle. Cling to Him today and believe.
—

items.title: Waiting - Grant Partrick

items.author: podcast@268generation.com (Passion City Church)
items.content:
Peter knew it, do you? Do you know that we are all living in the end times? Do you see that now more than ever the world is looking at Christians to see how we will respond to the pressures and pains of these days? If so, it has to change the way you act in four distinct ways:
 

  1. Act with patience.
  2.  Act with urgency.
  3. Act with confidence.
  4. Act with Congruency.

—

items.title: Is This The End?

items.author: podcast@268generation.com (Passion City Church)
items.content:
Cast all your anxiety on Him, because He cares for you.

This is, without question one of the most anxiety-inducing years any of us have ever lived through. Yet, even in the middle of all 2020 has brought with it, God has a message for each and every one of us:
Through His grace, He will restore us and make us strong, firm, and steadfast. We can release what we are concerned about because God is concerned about us.

—

items.title: Positioned for Powerful Influence - Louie + Shelley Giglio

items.author: podcast@268generation.com (Passion City Church)
items.content:
Dear friends, I urge you, as foreigners and exiles, to abstain from sinful desires, which wage war against your soul. Live such good lives among the pagans that, though they accuse you of doing wrong, they may see your good deeds and glorify God on the day he visits us. Submit yourselves for the Lord’s sake to every human authority: whether to the emperor, as the supreme authority, or to governors, who are sent by him to punish those who do wrong and to commend those who do right. For it is God’s will that by doing good you should silence the ignorant talk of foolish people. Live as free people, but do not use your freedom as a cover-up for evil; live as God’s slaves. Show proper respect to everyone, love the family of believers, fear God, honor the emperor.

1 Peter 2: 11-17

—

This week, Pastor Louie Giglio walks with us through one of the important ideas in scripture: all of us who call ourselves Christians are on display, living among the lost, and most of us are the only representation of the Gospel that the people in our worlds will ever see. So how are we living that out? What are we actually putting on display with our lives?

—

Give towards what God is doing through Passion City Church: https://passioncitychurch.com/give-online

—

With Passion City Online you can join us every Sunday for gatherings at 10a + 1p + 5p + 8p! Join us at https://passioncitychurch.com/online

https://www.youtube.com/passioncitychurch1

—

https://passion.link/passionkidsonline

—

At Passion City Church, we believe that because God has displayed the ultimate sacrifice in Jesus, our response to that in worship must be extravagant. It is our privilege, and our created purpose, to reflect God’s Glory to Him through our praise, our sacrifice, and our song.

—

items.title: Fear of God

items.author: podcast@268generation.com (Passion City Church)
items.content:
Here's what is true; we are all going to go in the fire at one point or another. We will face seemingly insurmountable obstacles and immovable mountains. Life will not go according to our plans, and we will find ourselves in a furnace, wondering how long we can stand the fire. That is until we remember that we are not standing on the flames themselves. We are fixed upon that sure foundation, the cornerstone of Jesus. He is our rock, our living stone.

This is good news because standing on a living rock means we are never alone. He is in the fire with us. And while Jesus is with us in the trials, guess who is watching Him work… the whole world.

—

items.title: A Chip Off the Old Block

items.author: podcast@268generation.com (Passion City Church)
items.content:
Today it is imperative that you know WHO you are. God wants to remind you that you are chosen, you are Holy, you are God’s. You have to know who you are, in order to know WHY you are. This is the equation of every believer. You once were not, but now you are. You didn’t, but now you do. You were without, but now you’re with. Because of what God has done, you may now declare His praise.

—

items.content:
This week in our Everybody series, Pastor Louie Giglio helps us see how even a big church can be made small when we are willing to be known by the people around us. The truth is that even when we are in Christ, there will be moments that test us, and without the rooting of ourselves in God's Word and His Church, we can find ourselves lost in the fog.

items.title: Rails to Trails

items.author: podcast@268generation.com (Passion City Church)
items.content:
God wants you to awaken to the possibility that His promises and purposes and power can be accessed by everybody—and you are in the everybody. Let that truth sink in. This grand plan that God has, you're not somehow excluded from it. He is inviting you into all He has for you, and all He wants to accomplish through you. Are you willing to take a step towards Him?

 —

items.title: This Is For Me

items.author: podcast@268generation.com (Passion City Church)
items.content:
Life was never meant to be lived alone. We are designed to live life in communities, in circles. This week, Pastor Louie Giglio kicked off a new series titled, Everybody, where he broke down seven reasons why it's important to be fully seen and known in a small circle of community. 

  1. Jesus is in the Circle.
  2. Everybody knows your name.
  3. Your Understanding of God Grows. 
  4. You're cared for and you care for others. 
  5. You learn to defer in love.
  6. You put down roots.
  7. You are covered and accountable. 

—

Give towards what God is doing through Passion City Church: https://passioncitychurch.com/give-online

—

With Passion City Online you can join us every Sunday for gatherings at 10a + 1p + 5p + 8p! Join us at https://passioncitychurch.com/online

https://www.youtube.com/passioncitychurch1

https://passion.link/passionkidsonline

items.title: Where Everybody Knows Your Name

items.content:

items.content:
"If it's big enough to worry about, it's big enough to pray about." Are you struggling with anxiety, worry, and stress these days? Did you know Jesus dealt with these exact feelings, too? This week, Pastor Craig Groeschel encourages us to call on the God who understands us the most. We can cast our cares on Him because He cares for us.

items.content:
When you hear the story of the Good Samaritan, who do you see yourself as in the story? As the fourth voice in our SEVEN series, Pastor Levi Lusko reminds us of our true place in the Kingdom of God, as a people who are in desperate need of a Savior. 

—

items.author: podcast@268generation.com (Passion City Church)
items.content:
Your current position is not your final position.

Think about that.

Sickness is not your final position.
Despair is not your final position.
Anxiety is not your final position.

Your final position is with Jesus. This week, Pastor Louie Giglio brings you a powerful message of hope as he reminds us of the story of Joseph, a man who served God his whole life and would eventually be brought through all manner of highs and lows to his final position in God's promised land.
—
With Passion City Online you can join us every Sunday for gatherings at 10a + 1p + 5p + 8p! Join us at https://passioncitychurch.com/online
—
Subscribe to our channel to see more messages from Passion City Church:
https://www.youtube.com/passioncitych...
—
Looking for content for your Kids? Subscribe to our BRAND NEW Passion Kids Channel:
https://passion.link/passionkidsonline
—

It is our privilege, and our created purpose, to reflect God’s Glory to Him through our praise, our sacrifice, and our song.Follow Passion City Church: https://www.instagram.com/passioncity/
Follow Louie Giglio: https://www.instagram.com/louiegiglioPassion City Church is a Jesus church with locations in Atlanta and Washington D.C.

items.author: podcast@268generation.com (Passion City Church)
items.content:
Part three of our series, VICTORY: Winning the Battle of Your Mind is here with a powerful word from Pastor Louie Giglio. So many of us walk through each day carrying thoughts of guilt, shame, and condemnation; but where do those thoughts come from? Are they from God, or are they from an enemy who wants to derail you from the purpose God has for your life?

items.title: Seven Supernatural Thoughts

items.author: podcast@268generation.com (Passion City Church)
items.content:
The battle for the mind is not one you have to fight alone. Even when everything inside of you feels like it's shifting and uncertain, Jesus is standing in the middle of your chaos with you, and He has a message for you. He has already won the battle, now it's time for you to step into that very victory.

—

items.content:encoded:
The battle for the mind is not one you have to fight alone. Even when everything inside of you feels like it's shifting and uncertain, Jesus is standing in the middle of your chaos with you, and He has a message for you. He has already won the battle, now it's time for you to step into that very victory.

items.content:
"Injustice is about the system. Racism is about the heart. The Church needs to address is as a purposefully fight, not some mystical force in the air that's not that bad."

 

Join Dan Cathy, Lecrae, and Louie Giglio for an open and honest conversation around how racism has plagued our city for generations, and the steps we can all take to confront it head-on in our church, our neighborhoods and our hearts.

—

items.title: Extravagant Worship

items.author: podcast@268generation.com (Passion City Church)
items.content:
“Humility is birthed at the foot of the cross."

—

In the second week of our series ANCHOR, Pastor Ben Stuart brings a timely and important message about the radical grace of God. We are not only reconciled with God through the cross; the cross also restores relationships with each other. The gospel is not worth preaching if it does not have the power to break down the wall dividing ethnic groups. The grace of God is so radical that it makes enemies not just into friends but into a family.

—

With Passion City Online you can join us every Sunday for gatherings at 10a + 1p + 5p + 8p! Join us at https://passioncitychurch.com/online

items.title: Radical Grace

items.author: podcast@268generation.com (Passion City Church)
items.content:
“He must increase, but I must decrease.” John 3:30

This is a powerful statement from someone who understood what mattered most to God, and therefore what should matter most to us. But it’s hard, it’s difficult to wrap our minds why we have to decrease, and what that really means. Pastor Brad Jones kicks off a new series, ANCHOR, with a look at the life of John the Baptist, and what we can learn from this famous exchange between him and his followers to help us see not only what matters most to God, but what matters most to us as well.

—

items.title: Glory of God

items.author: podcast@268generation.com (Passion City Church)
items.content:
Almost nothing is guaranteed, except for two things:

Life is Hard. God is Good.

That’s it; those are the two guarantees we’re walking away with today. The first one, life is hard, no one ever really had to teach us. The second one is a whole different story.

God is good… all the time.

So what happens when that truth faces off against real life? What happens when we are confronted with the truth that the story of Jesus-followers is a story of hardship? How do we reconcile the mountain of victory we’re standing on with the hardship the story of our spiritual lineage holds?

We embrace it and we look at the life of Paul.

—

With Passion City Online you can join us every Sunday for gatherings at 10a + 1p + 5p + 8p! Join us at https://passioncitychurch.com/online

items.content:
"The space between what you thought your life was going to be and what your life really is, is the space of your suffering."
 

Are you facing adversity today? Does your life look different than the way you always imagined it would? Join Pastor Louie Giglio and Jay + Katherine Wolf for a conversation focused on trusting God with the reality of your situation.

items.title: Let's Start Over - Jay + Katherine Wolf

items.author: podcast@268generation.com (Passion City Church)
items.content:
How we handle hardship could be the heroic thing inside of all of us. Just look at the life of King David:

 

David was anointed by God as a teenager, told he would be king in time. He played the harp for the king, killed the giant Goliath, became the head of the military and married the king’s daughter. David was the most famous person in the whole kingdom and beloved by everyone around him.

 

Everyone except the king.


 

Join Pastor Ben Stuart as he breaks down how each of us can learn from the life of David how we can handle hard times in a way that leads us to a heroic life.

—

items.title: Pain + Possibility

items.author: podcast@268generation.com (Passion City Church)
items.content:
This probably isn't how you imagined your year would look. Chances are you didn't anticipate a global pandemic, a shelter-in-place order or having to spend each day wondering when things would return to the way they were. There was no plan for postponing your dream wedding, celebrating your grandson's birthday through a video call or mourning the loss of a loved one with far fewer people than they deserved. 

You didn't ask for your situation, but you can turn the page on it.

With Passion City Online you can join us every Sunday for gatherings at 10a + 1p + 5p + 8p! Join us at https://passioncitychurch.com/online

—

You didn't ask for your situation, but you can turn the page on it.
With Passion City Online you can join us every Sunday for gatherings at 10a + 1p + 5p + 8p! Join us at https://passioncitychurch.com/online

items.title: What Now?

items.author: podcast@268generation.com (Passion City Church)
items.content:
David knew what it felt like to experience moments of desperation. If the man who conquered Goliath (with the help of God) as a small child found his heart growing faint at times, maybe we can say to ourselves: It's okay to freak out. 

—

items.title: Death is Cancelled

items.author: podcast@268generation.com (Passion City Church)
items.content:
These days are hard. They aren’t what we planned, and there’s no end in sight. So how are we supposed to not only live through these days but to live well in the midst of them?

The answer can be found in the book of Hebrews.

But recall the former days when, after you were enlightened, you endured a hard struggle with sufferings, (you came out of the blocks strong!) sometimes being publicly exposed to reproach and affliction, and sometimes being partners with those so treated. For you had compassion on those in prison, and you joyfully accepted the plundering of your property, since you knew that you yourselves had a better possession and an abiding one. Therefore do not throw away your confidence, which has a great reward. For you have need of endurance, so that when you have done the will of God you may receive what is promised.

Hebrews 10:32-36

Endurance, we need endurance.

Here’s the good news. You can have it.

So how do we gain the endurance we are going to need in order not only to endure the days ahead but to excel in them?

—

With Passion City Online you can join us every Sunday for gatherings at 10a + 1p + 5p + 8p, as well as learn more about Passion City Church, our beliefs, leadership and culture by joining us for Welcome to Church! Join us at https://passioncitychurch.com/online

—

https://www.youtube.com/passioncitych...

https://passion.link/passionkidsonline

At Passion City Church, we believe that because God has displayed the ultimate sacrifice in Jesus, our response to that in worship must be extravagant. It is our privilege, and our created purpose, to reflect God’s Glory to Him through our praise, our sacrifice, and our song.

items.title: How Will We Make It?

items.author: podcast@268generation.com (Passion City Church)
items.content:
Where is God?

It's a valid question and one that no one should feel shame about asking. One of the wonderful attributes of God is that He isn't afraid of our questions. Our searching for God gives Him another chance to put His Glory and His overarching story on display.

Besides, this is hardly a new question.

Overwhelming? Yes.

Original? No.

It's the very same question that has bounced around the minds of believers and skeptics for thousands of years.

—

It's the very same question that has bounced around the minds of believers and skeptics for thousands of years.

items.title: Where is God?

items.author: podcast@268generation.com (Passion City Church)
items.content:
What the world needs most today, what our cities and communities need most today, what we all need most today is a spiritual awakening. Here’s the good news.

It’s possible.

Right now, God is closer to you than you think.

How close?
 

Twenty inches. Twenty inches is all that separates you from, “then I will hear from heaven, and I will forgive their sin and will heal their land.”

 

It’s the twenty inches between your knees and the ground. It’s assuming a position of kneeling before the mighty God and admitting that you need help. Twenty inches to go from death to life. Twenty inches that change your story from, “I was a victim of circumstance,” to, “I found Jesus, and He stood me up victorious.”

 

God is closer than you imagine today, and He’s calling you. Will you answer?
 

—

 

With Passion City Church Online you can join us every Sunday for gathering at 10a + 1p + 5p +8p, as well as learn more about Passion City Church, it’s beliefs, leadership, and culture by joining us for Welcome to Church! Join us at https://passioncitychurch.com/online

 

Subscribe to our channel to see more messages from Passion City Church: https://www.youtube.com/passioncitych...

 

Looking for content for your Kids? Subscribe to our BRAND NEW Passion Kids Channel:

https://passion.link/passionkidsonline

 

—

 

At Passion City Church we believe that because God has displayed the ultimate sacrifice in Jesus, our response to that in worship must be extravagant. It is our privilege, and our created purpose, to reflect God’s Glory back to Him through our praise, our sacrifice, and our song.

items.title: 20 Inches to Mercy

items.author: podcast@268generation.com (Passion City Church)
items.content:
"We have never seen anything like this."

How many times have you heard that this week? We're living in unprecedented times to be sure, but are we on our own? Whenever faced with times of uncertainty, doesn't it feel like we hear people taking one of two stances? Either we believe that our hope and confidence is in a sovereign God who always has and will always have a plan for our good and His Glory, or we can believe that in one way or another faith in God is simply a crutch to lean on when we aren't strong enough to face what is right in front of us.

But Christianity is not a crutch.

—

This week Pastor Louie Giglio continues our VICTORY series with a message that is timely to the days we are living in. Teaching out of Mark 2:1-12 Pastor Louie reminds us of a few critical things:
 

1. Our faith can move the heart of God and impact the eternal destiny of someone around us.

2. The paralyzed man's problem was bigger than he thought.

3. Jesus didn't offer a crutch. He healed him.

—

Subscribe to our channel to see more messages from Passion City Church: https://www.youtube.com/passioncitychurch1

 

At Passion City Church we believe that because God has displayed the ultimate sacrifice in Jesus, our response to that in worship must be extravagant. It is our privilege, and our created purpose, to reflect God’s Glory back to Him through our praise, our sacrifice, and our song.
 

Follow @passioncity: https://www.instagram.com/passioncity/

Follow @louiegiglio: https://www.instagram.com/louiegiglio/

 

Passion City Church is a Jesus church with locations in Atlanta and Washington D.C.

items.title: Why Christianity is Not a Crutch

items.author: podcast@268generation.com (Passion City Church)
items.content:
Do we have to sin?

What a question.

Here's another one: are we sinners trying to act like saints, or is it possible that we are saints who have the ability to choose sin?

—

God. Is. Faithful.

Three words that change everything reminding us that sin is not the end of our story. God has provided a way out so we can endure and escape the temptation to chose anything other than Him.

So, do we have to sin?

No.

Do we need the grace of God? Yes.

Do we need the mercy of God? Yes.

Do we need the forgiveness of God? Yes.

But do we have to sin? No.

—

items.title: The Spiral of Sin and Temptation - part 2

items.author: podcast@268generation.com (Passion City Church)
items.content:
You can live in freedom.

—

Thoughts that go unchecked long enough in our minds cause us to stumble and sin against God. It’s the enemy’s plan to let these thoughts fester and grow. However, we must remember that the work of Jesus is FINISHED. Not only has Jesus established a beachhead for us to launch into #Victory—he has provided us with blueprints of the enemy’s plans. In the power of the Holy Spirit and the knowledge of how the enemy operates, we defend our thoughts and break the cycle of sin and temptation! Join us next week as we dive into practical steps to defend ourselves against the enemy.⁣

⁣

To beat the enemy’s plan, it helps to know his thoughts. Look at the seven steps below that lead to the spiral of sin and temptation so that you can fight the enemy.⁣

⁣

1. A temptation from the enemy enters our minds.⁣

2. We act on that temptation and we sin.⁣

3. There is usually momentary pleasure.⁣

4. We discover sin’s hook.⁣

5. We are met by feelings of frustration guilt and shame.⁣

6. The enemy shifts to a new tactic - condemnation.⁣

7. We find ourselves vulnerable, weak, isolated, empty and longing.⁣

—

Subscribe to our channel to see more messages from Passion City Church: https://www.youtube.com/passioncitychurch1


 

At Passion City Church we believe that because God has displayed the ultimate sacrifice in Jesus, our response to that in worship must be extravagant. It is our privilege, and our created purpose, to reflect God’s Glory back to Him through our praise, our sacrifice, and our song.

items.contentSnippet:
You can live in freedom.
—
Thoughts that go unchecked long enough in our minds cause us to stumble and sin against God. It’s the enemy’s plan to let these thoughts fester and grow. However, we must remember that the work of Jesus is FINISHED. Not only has Jesus established a beachhead for us to launch into #Victory—he has provided us with blueprints of the enemy’s plans. In the power of the Holy Spirit and the knowledge of how the enemy operates, we defend our thoughts and break the cycle of sin and temptation! Join us next week as we dive into practical steps to defend ourselves against the enemy.⁣
⁣
To beat the enemy’s plan, it helps to know his thoughts. Look at the seven steps below that lead to the spiral of sin and temptation so that you can fight the enemy.⁣
⁣
1. A temptation from the enemy enters our minds.⁣
2. We act on that temptation and we sin.⁣
3. There is usually momentary pleasure.⁣
4. We discover sin’s hook.⁣
5. We are met by feelings of frustration guilt and shame.⁣
6. The enemy shifts to a new tactic - condemnation.⁣
7. We find ourselves vulnerable, weak, isolated, empty and longing.⁣
—

items.title: The Spiral of Sin and Temptation - part 1

items.author: podcast@268generation.com (Passion City Church)
items.content:
“I’m going to win the battle of my mind because I have the power of the finished work of Jesus. I’m standing on victory and I’m going to move from that victory.” ⁣
- Louie Giglio
—
We can all relate to the feeling of having to contend for our thoughts, that's why this truth was so encouraging: Jesus has given us victory at The Cross, and through the power of the Holy Spirit the ability take every thought captive for his glory! 

Remember, when Jesus died and rose on the third day, he rose to glorious and victorious life both now and forever. When He did, he gave this life to anyone who will put their trust in Him. 

The battle in our minds is real; it's not something we can push away or ignore. We need to arm ourselves with Paul's reminder in 2 Corinthians 10:5, "We demolish arguments and every pretension that sets itself up against the knowledge of God, and we take captive every thought to make it obedient to Christ." 

The week, Pastor Louie left us with a  practical challenge. To exercise authority over our thoughts with these five steps: 

1. Examine it. Question it. Where did it come from? Does it match up with God's Word?

2. Bind that thought before it binds you. Negative, tempting, or fearful thoughts will capture us if we don't take ahold of them first, rooted in the Word to know what God says about them. Let the Scripture sink in your heart and head so that the enemy can't short-circuit your calling or steal your purpose.

3. Change the narrative. Don't merely bind the bad but begin to think about whatever is pure and good and lovely and praiseworthy (Phil 4:8) and write a new story.

4. Act on that truth.

5. Repeat. What is the thought that is binding you today? Examine it, bind it, and speak the truth in its place and begin walking in victory, the νικος of Christ!
—

items.title: Winning the Battle of the Mind

items.author: podcast@268generation.com (Passion City Church)
items.content:
“Comfort is not a fruit of the Spirit. Neither is convenience. Neither is easy. The gospel is about moving out. So let’s not put limits on where the gospel is going to take us.” ⁣- Pastor Brad Jones

—

Jesus has wired us with a mindset of reach so that others can receive the Good News of Jesus. The gospel is moving and the light of Jesus is spreading. Are you willing to move with it?⁣ Are you willing to deliver?

—⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣

Key takeaways:

—⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣

+ Jesus alone has the power to perform miracles, give life and heal our soul.⁣

+ If you want God to use your life for the extraordinary, then posture yourself as a receiver.⁣

+ Jesus is the bread of life. When we choose Him for spiritual nourishment, we will never go hungry.⁣

+ The disciples were ready not to produce a miracle, but rather to participate in a miracle.

—

Subscribe to our channel to see more messages from Passion City Church: https://www.youtube.com/passioncitychurch1

Passion City Church is a Jesus church with locations in Atlanta and Washington D.C.

items.title: We Deliver

items.author: podcast@268generation.com (Passion City Church)
items.content:
"God almighty is a perfect Father and he wants to weave you into a story of value. He wants you to know that you have dignity. You have worth. He offered a self-sacrificing kind of love for you." - Pastor Louie Giglio ⁣

—⁣

Through the cross, God's love for us is complete. Jesus wants to write a new story in your life. How will you respond?

—

items.title: Sadie Rob Huff - Following Jesus in the Unknown

items.author: podcast@268generation.com (Passion City Church)
items.content:
“It looks like you were left for dead. But guess what? God still has a purpose, and He still has a plan for you. And I want to speak it over you. I want to walk beside you, call you up to believe that God can do more.”⁣ -Louie Giglio

—

As we continue our ROAR series, Pastor Louie Giglio brings us a message out of Ephesians 5 about what has to happen in our lives before we can ROAR to the world around us.

items.title: The Yawn Before the Roar

items.author: podcast@268generation.com (Passion City Church)
items.content:
“Our boldness has a root, but our boldness also has a result.”⁣ -Ben Stuart⁣ —⁣⁣ Our belief in God prompts action, and boldness leads to activity.⁣⁣ This week Pastor Ben Stuart reminds us that our confidence comes from the change Jesus has made in our lives, and when we speak out of that confidence, people will notice.

At Passion City Church we believe that because God has displayed the ultimate sacrifice in Jesus, our response to that in worship must be extravagant. It is our privilege, and our created purpose, to reflect God’s Glory back to Him through our praise, our sacrifice, and our song. 

Follow Passion City Church: https://www.instagram.com/passioncity/ 

Follow Ben Stuart: https://www.instagram.com/ben_stuart_ 

Passion City Church is a Jesus church with locations in Atlanta and Washington D.C. More info on Passion: https://passioncitychurch.com
